androidx.slice

Class SliceUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.slice.SliceUtils

  • public class SliceUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for dealing with slices.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SliceUtils.SerializeOptions
      Holds options for how to handle SliceItems that cannot be serialized.
      static interface  SliceUtils.SliceActionListener
      A listener used to receive events on slices parsed with parseSlice(Context, InputStream, String, SliceActionListener).
      static class  SliceUtils.SliceParseException
      Exception thrown during parseSlice(Context, InputStream, String, SliceActionListener).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int LOADING_ALL
      Indicates this slice is empty and waiting for content to be loaded.
      static int LOADING_COMPLETE
      Indicates this slice has fully loaded and is not waiting for other content.
      static int LOADING_PARTIAL
      Indicates this slice has some content but is waiting for other content to be loaded.

    • Method Detail

      • stripSlice

        @NonNull
public static Slice stripSlice(@NonNull
                                        Slice s,
                                        int mode,
                                        boolean isScrollable)
        Attempt to remove any extra content from the slice.

        This is meant to be used alongside serializeSlice(androidx.slice.Slice, Context, java.io.OutputStream, java.lang.String, androidx.slice.SliceUtils.SerializeOptions) to reduce the size of a slice by only including data for the slice to be displayed in a specific mode.

        Parameters:
        s - The slice to strip.
        mode - The mode that will be used with SliceView.setMode(int) to display the slice.
        isScrollable - The value that will be used with SliceView.setScrollable(boolean) to display the slice.
        Returns:
        returns A new smaller slice if stripping can be done, or the original slice if no content can be removed.

      • serializeSlice

        public static void serializeSlice(@NonNull
                                  Slice s,
                                  @NonNull
                                  Context context,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.io.OutputStream output,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.String encoding,
                                  @NonNull
                                  SliceUtils.SerializeOptions options)
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Serialize a slice to an OutputStream.

        The slice can later be read into slice form again with parseSlice(Context, java.io.InputStream, java.lang.String, androidx.slice.SliceUtils.SliceActionListener). Some slice types cannot be serialized, their handling is controlled by SliceUtils.SerializeOptions.

        Parameters:
        s - The slice to serialize.
        context - Context used to load any resources in the slice.
        output - The output of the serialization.
        encoding - The encoding to use for serialization.
        options - Options defining how to handle non-serializable items.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the slice cannot be serialized using the given options.
        java.io.IOException

      • serializeSlice

        public static void serializeSlice(@NonNull
                                  Slice s,
                                  @NonNull
                                  Context context,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.io.OutputStream output,
                                  @NonNull
                                  SliceUtils.SerializeOptions options)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Serialize a slice to an OutputStream.

        The serialized slice can later be read into slice form again with parseSlice(Context, java.io.InputStream, java.lang.String, androidx.slice.SliceUtils.SliceActionListener). Some slice types cannot be serialized, their handling is controlled by SliceUtils.SerializeOptions.

        Parameters:
        s - The slice to serialize.
        context - Context used to load any resources in the slice.
        output - The output of the serialization.
        options - Options defining how to handle non-serializable items.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the slice cannot be serialized using the given options.

      • parseSlice

        @NonNull
public static Slice parseSlice(@NonNull
                                        Context context,
                                        @NonNull
                                        java.io.InputStream input,
                                        @NonNull
                                        java.lang.String encoding,
                                        @NonNull
                                        SliceUtils.SliceActionListener listener)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        SliceUtils.SliceParseException
        Parse a slice that has been previously serialized.

        Parses a slice that was serialized with serializeSlice(androidx.slice.Slice, Context, java.io.OutputStream, java.lang.String, androidx.slice.SliceUtils.SerializeOptions).

        Note: Slices returned by this cannot be passed to SliceConvert.unwrap(Slice).

        Parameters:
        input - The input stream to read from.
        encoding - The encoding to read as.
        listener - Listener used to handle actions when reconstructing the slice.
        Throws:
        SliceUtils.SliceParseException - if the InputStream cannot be parsed.
        java.io.IOException

      • getLoadingState

        public static int getLoadingState(@NonNull
                                  Slice slice)
        Returns:
        the current loading state of the provided Slice.

      • getSliceActions

        @Nullable
public static java.util.List<SliceItem> getSliceActions(@NonNull
                                                                  Slice slice)
        Returns:
        the group of actions associated with the provided slice, if they exist.

      • getSliceKeywords

        @Nullable
public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSliceKeywords(@NonNull
                                                                          Slice slice)
        Returns:
        the list of keywords associated with the provided slice, null if no keywords were specified or an empty list if the slice was specified to have no keywords.
